meanings.definition: The quality of being impertinent or disrespectful.
meanings.sent1: Her saucinesses in class often got her in trouble with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: I was taken aback by the saucinesses of his remarks during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Despite his saucinesses, he managed to charm his way out of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's saucinesses towards the audience added an extra layer of humor to the show.
meanings.sent5: The saucinesses in her tone made it clear she was not to be trifled with.

meanings.definition: The state of being bold or cheeky.
meanings.sent1: His saucinesses in asking for a raise impressed his boss.
meanings.sent2: The children giggled at the little girl's saucinesses during the play.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's saucinesses in stealing socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her saucinesses shone through as she confidently delivered her speech.
meanings.sent5: The cat's saucinesses were evident in the way it played with the toy mouse.

meanings.definition: The act of being lively or spirited.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of saucinesses, with guests dancing and laughing.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's saucinesses brightened up the room with its playful antics.
meanings.sent3: The saucinesses of the music had everyone tapping their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her saucinesses on the dance floor were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The children's saucinesses during the game brought joy to all who watched.
